page.title: 02AGRICULTURE
page.content: 75% of the total land area is given to agriculture. There are four major land owners, Mr.D.CARR at Campsmount Home Farm,Mr.C.METCALFE at Priory Farm,Norton,Mr.J.COOKE at Priory Farm,Norton and the Lodge family,all chiefly arable farmers. The chief crops grown are wheat,barley,a little oats, potatoes,peas and oil seed rape. There is also some sugar beet. Mr.Cooke grows a specialised fodder called Lucerne,being one of only five producers in the country.There is also a specialised fruit farm.(See{NORTON {STRAWBERRY GROWERS}). Arable farming is the chosen method here chiefly because of the well drained light limestone soil which does not lend itself to double cropping of hay. Another factor is that it does not require the everyday presence of milk production or stock
